H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H2930.def: = process by which humans, or objects are or become contaminated, ◄ as a result of contagious diseases or conditions, unlawful activities, or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability of being used or participating in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7607.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= process by which humans, or objects are or become contaminated, ◄ as a result of contagious diseases or conditions, unlawful activities, or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability of being used or participating in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H7139.def: literally: to make bald baldness; hence: = action by which a human being uses a sharp implement to remove the hair on (part of) his scalp, ► as a sign of mourning

H7144.def: = a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6285.def: = one of the sides or corners of an object

H2206.def: = a growth of hair on the chin and lower cheeks of a mature man’s face, ≈ the absence of which is regarded as shameful

H1548.def: = action by which humans cut the hair on all or part of their body

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
